s.text: Lewis won the close bout in a unanimous decision , making him the first undisputed titleholder since 1992.
The Republicans won: 1) a 0.38 percent across-the-board budget cut; 2) increased spending on defense and veterans' health; and 3) the ability to claim to have protected the Social Security surplus.
The Republicans won: 1) a 0.38 percent across-the-board budget cut; 2) increased spending on defense and veterans' health; and 3) the ability to claim to have protected the Social Security surplus.
The Republicans won: 1) a 0.38 percent across-the-board budget cut; 2) increased spending on defense and veterans' health; and 3) the ability to claim to have protected the Social Security surplus.
It was a rematch of a March fight, which ended officially in a draw but was widely believed to have been won by Lewis.
The Republicans won: 1) a 0.38 percent across-the-board budget cut; 2) increased spending on defense and veterans' health; and 3) the ability to claim to have protected the Social Security surplus.
Sportswriters exulted that Lewis finally got what he deserved . But skeptics said that scoring discrepancies revealed "something less than a definitive way of judging a bout."
